facts.text: Appellate Assistant Commissioner order dated October 16, 1958 deleted Rs. 75,000 addition but allowed reduction of only Rs. 70,510 due to undervaluation of closing stock of Eveready torches by Rs. 4,490

facts.text: Income-tax Officer appealed to Income-tax Appellate Tribunal

facts.text: Tribunal restored addition made by Income-tax Officer less Rs. 4,490

anchor.surface_text: which restored the addition made by the Income-tax Officer, less the above sum of Rs. 4,490. It was pointed out to the Appellate Tribunal that the Appellate Assistant Commissioner had lost sigh of the fact that even in the preceding year goods from the National Carbon Company Ltd. did figure in the trading account of the respondent, and that if these goods are eliminated from the accounts, the margin of profit in the preceding year was 11.3 per cent.

facts.text: Preceding year margin of profit 11.3 per cent after eliminating National Carbon Company goods; year of account 5.8 per cent

anchor.surface_text: It was pointed out to the Appellate Tribunal that the Appellate Assistant Commissioner had lost sigh of the fact that even in the preceding year goods from the National Carbon Company Ltd. did figure in the trading account of the respondent, and that if these goods are eliminated from the accounts, the margin of profit in the preceding year was 11.3 per cent. as against 5.8 per cent. of the year of account, as worked out by the Appellate Assistant Commissioner.

facts.text: Respondents doing business mainly on wholesale basis, no difficulty in tallying quantities of major items

anchor.surface_text: The Tribunal observed that Since the respondents were doing business in the main on a wholesale basis there should have been numberdifficulty in tallying quantities in respect of major items of the trading account. In the absence of such a tally, the fall in the margin of profits cannot be satisfactorily explained by a proper analysis of the trading account.

facts.text: Respondents had quota of imports worth Rs. 8,00,000 which would give handsome margin of profit

anchor.surface_text: The fall in the margin is all the more difficult to explain in view of the fact that the respondents also had quota of imports worth about Rs. 8,00,000 which would have given them a handsome margin of profit. We are, therefore, satisfied that the proviso to section 13 was clearly applicable to the trading results in this case and having regard to the nature of business and the availability of imported materials the margin taken by the Income-tax Officer seems to be quite reasonable.

facts.text: Tribunal held proviso to section 13 applicable and Income-tax Officer margin reasonable

anchor.surface_text: We are, therefore, satisfied that the proviso to section 13 was clearly applicable to the trading results in this case and having regard to the nature of business and the availability of imported materials the margin taken by the Income-tax Officer seems to be quite reasonable. precedents.cited_proposition: reliability of accounts is question of fact for Income-tax Officer; finding not to be disturbed if reasons not capricious even if material meagre
